metadata.title: CVE-2019-19377 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel 5.0.21, mounting a crafted btrfs filesystem image,performing some operations, and unmounting can lead to a use-after-free inbtrfs_queue_work in fs/btrfs/async-thread.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19377` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-109-generic - 4.15.0-109.110
linux-image-4.15.0-109-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-109.110
linux-image-4.15.0-109-lowlatency - 4.15.0-109.110
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-109-generic - 4.15.0-109.110
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-109-lowlatency - 4.15.0-109.110
No subscription required

linux-image-5.3.0-53-generic - 5.3.0-53.47~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-109.110').
linux-hwe package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.3.0-53.47~18.04.1').
linux-oem package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1091.101').
linux-oem-osp1: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
